Topic: Draw a fish in their habitat with labels.
Level Description: Advanced (complete and accurate representation of all elements)
CAN: The student can include a detailed drawing of a fish in a natural habitat, such as a pond, river, or ocean.
The student can accurately label the different parts of the fish, like its fins, gills, and scales.
The student can draw and label various elements of the fish's habitat, such as water, plants, or rocks, demonstrating how they meet the fish's needs.
The student can illustrate the relationship between the fish and the water, clearly showing how water is necessary for the fish to survive.
The student can illustrate and label other organisms or components of the ecosystem, like aquatic plants or other fish, accurately showing interaction within the habitat.
The student can demonstrate and label how different parts of the ecosystem work together as a system to support the fish's life needs.
